page.title: 02CHURCH STRETTON
page.content: Church Stretton is a small town in a deep narrow valley surrounded by hills. It is a{popular tourist centre. The majority of Church Stretton's population is retired. A lot of people come here to retire. A popular aspect of Church Stretton is the Long Mynd. The Long Mynd is a hill ten miles in length. It has got a lot of interesting footpaths. Church Stretton has a population of about 4000, 250 of which are chidren of primary school age. There is a market held in the square every Thursday. Annually in the square a May Day celebration takes place. Church Stretton can boast that it is set as 'Shepwardine' in the novels of the famous authoress{Mary Webb.}She spent her honeymoon in the picturesque village of Church Stretton.
